definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: The inward life of those upon whom solitude has been thrust is a threshing floor of emotions.
sentences.chinese: 孤寂的人他们的内心生活已被孤独逼为情感的打谷场。

sentences.english: They are going to weather the corn in the thrashing field.
sentences.chinese: 他们要把玉米在打谷场晾晒干。

sentences.english: Like chaff from a threshing floor.
sentences.chinese: 象打谷场上飞迸的谷糠。

sentences.english: John is leading his dog around the threshing floor.
sentences.chinese: 约翰正在把他的狗领到打谷场周围。

sentences.english: The fox reached the threshing-floor and shook his tail happily.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸跑到了打谷场，高兴地摇晃着尾巴。

definition: to thresh or husk grain on a threshing ground (dialect)
embankment or foothpath between paddy fields
